1.learning_goal: Core Python Foundations: In this unit, students will learn to write and run simple Python scripts using print(), variables, strings, and numbers; perform basic arithmetic (including division modes and modulo); format and convert data types; collect and use user input; read and fix common errors with tracebacks; and define, call, and return values from basic functions to solve small real-world-style problems.

chapters.title: First Steps with Python
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will write and run their first Python programs, use `print()` effectively, and start working with variables and strings. Through short practice projects, they will combine text, numbers, and formatting to create simple, readable console outputs.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Welcome to PY101
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand the course main topics and grading

lessons.title: Writing your first program
lessons.learning_outcomes: Write and execute a simple Python script using the print() function

lessons.title: Unlocking print() power-ups
lessons.learning_outcomes: Print multiple values using commas; Understand that printing is always in a new line; Print multiple text and numeric values using the + and * operators.

lessons.title: Introduction to variables
lessons.learning_outcomes: Explain that a variable is a named placeholder for a value in memory.; Write a valid variable name following Python conventions.; Assign a value (e.g., a number or a piece of text) to a variable using the = operator.; Use the print() function to display the value stored in a variable.

lessons.title: Working with text
lessons.learning_outcomes: Define a "data type" as a category of data that determines what you can do with it.; Create a string variable by enclosing text in single (') or double (") quotes.; Combine two strings using the + operator (concatenation).; Predict the output when printing string variables.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Welcome postcard
lessons.learning_outcomes: Create a simple Python script that prints a multi-line welcome postcard message using several print() calls. Output: The script prints a short, formatted welcome postcard to the screen.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Café menu board
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use multiple print() statements with commas, +, and * to display a café’s menu with repeated decorative elements. Output: The script prints a stylized café menu with repeated separators and combined text and numbers.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Character profile
lessons.learning_outcomes: Declare and assign variables for a story character’s basic info and print a short profile using those variables. Output: The script prints a character description using values stored in variables.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Story tagline mixer
lessons.learning_outcomes: Create and combine string variables with + to build different taglines for a short movie or game. Output: The script prints several composed taglines generated by concatenating string variables.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Working with Numbers in Python
chapters.learning_goals: Build confidence using Python to work with integers and floats, perform arithmetic, and model real‑world calculations. Learn to write, debug, and explain simple programs that use division modes, numeric variables, and clear print outputs.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Working with numbers
lessons.learning_outcomes: Distinguish between an integer (int, a whole number) and a float (float, a number with a decimal).; Create variables to store integer and float values.; Perform basic arithmetic operations (+, -, *, /) on numeric variables.; Explain why 5 is different from "5".

lessons.title: Modeling real-world calculations
lessons.learning_outcomes: Translate a two-step word problem into an arithmetic expression and compute the result.; Do arithmetic directly inside print() to produce clear, useful outputs.; Compare two equivalent formulations and choose the clearer one.

lessons.title: Review: writing your first program
lessons.learning_outcomes: Review and reinforce writing and running simple Python scripts using print(); Identify and correct common mistakes in first Python programs

lessons.title: Division modes: / vs // with quotient and remainder
lessons.learning_outcomes: Compute and contrast true division (/) and floor division (//) on integers; explain the difference.; Use // and % together to derive quotient and remainder for practical cases (e.g., packing/scheduling).

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Snack shop receipt
lessons.learning_outcomes: Store item prices as integers and floats, perform arithmetic, and print a basic receipt showing totals. Output: The script prints a simple receipt with item costs, subtotal, and total.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Road trip planner
lessons.learning_outcomes: Translate a two-step word problem (distance, fuel, cost) into arithmetic expressions and print clear explanations of the results. Output: The script prints the fuel needed and estimated fuel cost for a road trip.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Bug hunt in first scripts
lessons.learning_outcomes: Read small broken scripts using print() and variables, fix common errors, and re-run to verify correct output. Output: The script(s) run without errors and print the intended messages and values.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Pizza slice divider
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use /, //, and % to divide pizza slices among friends and report whole slices per person and leftovers. Output: The script prints how many slices each person gets and how many slices remain.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Coin jar counter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine integer and float arithmetic to compute the total value of a coin jar and explain the difference between 5 and "5". Output: The script prints the total money in the jar and a short note about numeric vs string "5".

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Working with Numbers and User Input
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to use modulo, rounding, and type conversion to handle real‑world numeric problems, and to format values clearly for users. Practice collecting and processing user input to build small interactive programs that make decisions and present polished outputs.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Modulo in practice: parity, cycles, positions
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use x % 2 to detect parity and explain why it works.; Apply modulo to cyclic positions (e.g., every Nth item, rotating shifts) to simplify branching.

lessons.title: Rounding, and money format
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use round(x, n) to control numeric precision.; Format prices with f"{x:.2f}" as a quick money-format (value vs representation).

lessons.title: Checking the facts
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use type() to check a variable's data type; Use the str(), int(), and float() functions to convert values between data types.

lessons.title: Talking to your program: getting input from users
lessons.learning_outcomes: Explain why programs interact with users and when input() is appropriate; collect input with clear prompts.; Convert numeric inputs to the correct type before computing and print a friendly summary.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Even-odd ticket checker
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use the modulo operator to detect parity of ticket numbers and print different messages for even and odd tickets. Output: The script prints whether each ticket number is even or odd with a short explanation.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Workout day cycle
lessons.learning_outcomes: Apply modulo to model a repeating 3- or 4-day workout schedule and determine today’s workout type from a day number. Output: The script prints which workout is scheduled for a given day number.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Café bill rounder
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use round() and f-strings with :.2f to format prices and totals for a café bill. Output: The script prints an itemized bill with neatly rounded prices and a total shown as money.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Type detective
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use type(), str(), int(), and float() to inspect and convert values, then compare results before and after conversion. Output: The script prints types of several variables and the outcomes of converting them between types.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Mini survey input
lessons.learning_outcomes: Collect user input with input(), convert numeric answers to the correct types, and print a friendly summary report. Output: The script asks a few questions and then prints a short personalized summary using the user’s answers.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Functions, Errors, and Debugging
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will learn to define and call Python functions, pass arguments, and use return values to build small, reusable programs. They will also learn to read and interpret tracebacks, intentionally debug errors, and combine core skills (printing, variables, arithmetic, and functions) in practical mini‑projects.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Python errors: meet the traceback
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand why Python provides a traceback and how it helps identify what went wrong; Identify parts of a traceback and different types of tracebacks

lessons.title: Challenge: core foundations
lessons.learning_outcomes: Student demonstrates understanding and can successfully complete the required skills for this challenge.

lessons.title: Functions i: why, define, and call
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand how functions reduce repetition and improve reuse.; Understand the structure of Python functions; Define a function with one or two parameters and call it with literals and variables

lessons.title: Functions ii: inside the function
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand the structure of a function, including its name, parameters, indentation, and return value.; Call functions with arguments correctly and trace how values are passed from the call site to parameters, verifying the flow using print statements.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Error explorer
lessons.learning_outcomes: Intentionally create and run small buggy scripts, read the traceback, and identify the error type and line causing the problem. Output: The script(s) produce tracebacks that the student uses to locate and then fix the errors.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Quiz recap challenge
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine printing, variables, and arithmetic in a small challenge script that demonstrates core skills from previous chapters. Output: The script prints a short “quiz score recap” using given scores and computed totals/averages.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Greeting functions
lessons.learning_outcomes: Define and call simple functions with parameters to generate customized greeting messages using literals and variables. Output: The script prints several personalized greetings produced by function calls.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Tip calculator - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Define functions that accept bill amounts and tip percentages as parameters, compute tips, and print intermediate values for tracing. Output: The script prints calculated tip amounts and totals for given bills using function calls.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Tip calculator - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Refine the tip calculator so functions return values instead of only printing, and use those return values to build a final summary. Output: The script prints a clear final bill summary using values returned from the tip calculator functions.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

lessons.title: Weekly Review Prep Session
lessons.learning_outcomes: We'll review key concepts and prepare for the assessment

lessons.title: Prep Lesson
lessons.learning_outcomes: Prep lesson for the weekly review

2.learning_goal: Decisions and Loops: In this unit, students will master writing and refactoring if/elif/else logic (including decision tables, logical operators, and identity vs equality), control program flow with for and while loops (using range, break, continue, counters, and totals), and work confidently with strings and lists (indexing, slicing, and common methods) to build small, well-structured scripts that make data-driven decisions.

chapters.title: Making Decisions with Booleans and Conditions
chapters.learning_goals: Learn how to use booleans, comparisons, logical operators, and membership tests to build clear, well-structured if/elif/else logic. Practice applying these tools in small programs that filter, classify, and gate real-world examples like orders, playlists, movies, and grades.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Logical operators: and/or/not and short-circuiting
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine comparisons with and, or, not to form compound conditions.; Show short-circuit behavior by adding prints to the right-hand side expression.

lessons.title: Booleans and comparisons: equality vs identity
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use True/False in expressions and store boolean results in variables.; Differentiate between '==' (value equality) and 'is' (identity equality).

lessons.title: String membership with 'in' in conditions
lessons.learning_outcomes: Test substring membership with 'in' and negate with 'not in'.; Use membership checks inside if/elif branches to drive simple decisions.

lessons.title: Elif and refactoring nested decisions
lessons.learning_outcomes: Refactor a nested if/else into an equivalent if/elif/else chain.; Order conditions to avoid overlaps and unreachable branches.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Cafe order filter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use and, or, and not with comparison and membership checks to decide which cafe orders qualify for a discount, while observing short-circuit behavior with print statements. Output: A script that prints which sample cafe orders get discounts and shows when right-hand conditions are skipped due to short-circuiting.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Identity vs equality checker
lessons.learning_outcomes: Differentiate clearly between == and is by comparing various values and objects, storing boolean results, and explaining each outcome. Output: A script that prints side‑by‑side results for == and is on several examples (numbers, strings, lists) and labels each as “same value”, “same object”, or “different”.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Music playlist keyword filter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use in and not in within if/elif/else chains to classify song titles based on genre-related keywords. Output: A script that loops over a list of song titles and prints a label (e.g., “Rock”, “Chill”, “Unknown”) for each based on keyword membership.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Movie recommendation gate
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine logical operators and, or, not with comparison and membership to decide whether to recommend a movie based on age, parental approval, and content tags. Output: A script that prints “Allowed” or “Blocked” for several sample viewers and movies, showing which conditions triggered each decision.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Grade feedback refactor
lessons.learning_outcomes: Refactor nested if/else structures into clean if/elif/else chains while ordering conditions to avoid overlaps and unreachable branches. Output: A script that takes a numeric score and prints one feedback message (A/B/C/D/F) using a well‑structured if/elif/else instead of nested ifs.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Controlling Program Flow with Loops and Logic
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to translate decision tables into clear if/elif/else code and control program execution using for and while loops with break and continue. By the end of the chapter, you will be able to design and implement loop-based solutions to real-world problems like counters, games, login limiters, and table generators while avoiding common pitfalls such as infinite loops.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Decision tables to branching logic
lessons.learning_outcomes: Translate a 3–5 row decision table into clear if/elif/else code.; Verify mutual exclusivity and completeness of the conditions.

lessons.title: For loops and range(): counting iterations
lessons.learning_outcomes: Write for loops with range(stop), range(start, stop), range(start, stop, step); Accumulate a total across iterations and print the result.; Generate even/odd sequences and countdowns with range.

lessons.title: Meet the while loop
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand what a while loop is and when it is more suitable than for.; Understand the risk of infinite loops and explain how to prevent them.; Write a while loop to repeat actions until a condition changes.

lessons.title: Loop control: break and continue
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand when to exit a loop early with break versus letting it complete naturally.; Insert break to exit early on a condition and continue to skip an iteration.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Shipping fee decision table
lessons.learning_outcomes: Translate a small decision table (weight vs destination vs membership) into mutually exclusive and complete if/elif/else logic. Output: A script that prints the correct shipping fee tier for several test orders based on the encoded decision table.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Workout step counter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use for loops with range() variations to count repetitions, accumulate a total, and generate simple sequences like even counts and countdowns. Output: A script that prints each exercise rep, shows an even‑number warmup list, a cooldown countdown, and the total reps completed.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Guess the number loop
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use a while loop to repeatedly ask for guesses until the user gets the number right, avoiding infinite loops with a clear exit condition. Output: A script that keeps asking for a guess, gives simple hints, and stops when the correct number is entered.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Login attempts limiter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine while with break and continue to limit login attempts, skip empty inputs, and stop early on success. Output: A script that simulates login with a maximum number of attempts, ignoring blank entries and exiting immediately once the correct password is entered.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Multiplication table generator
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use for loops with range(start, stop, step) and loop control (break) to generate partial multiplication tables and stop based on a condition. Output: A script that prints multiplication tables (e.g., for 2–5) and stops early when a product exceeds a given limit.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Decisions, Loops, and String Power
chapters.learning_goals: Build confidence using decisions, loops, counters, and functions to solve small programming problems, while upgrading string skills with indexing and slicing. By the end of the chapter, students will be able to write, debug, and combine these tools in practical scripts like quizzes, sales trackers, secret decoders, and password analyzers.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Counters and totals
lessons.learning_outcomes: Initialize and update a counter and running total correctly inside a loop.; Print the final counts and totals after the loop completes.

lessons.title: Challenge: functions, decisions and loops
lessons.learning_outcomes: Student demonstrates understanding and can successfully complete the required skills for this challenge.

lessons.title: Review: decisions and loops
lessons.learning_outcomes: Review and reinforce use of if/else, loops, and loop control statements; Diagnose and correct common logical and looping errors in code

lessons.title: String skills upgrade i: indexing and slicing
lessons.learning_outcomes: Access individual characters in a string using 0-based indexing.; Use slice notation [start:stop] and [start:stop:step] to extract substrings.; Use negative indices to access characters from the end of a string.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Cafe daily sales counter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use counters and running totals inside loops to track number of items sold and total revenue, printing final stats afterward. Output: A script that processes a list of sample orders, prints each, and then prints total items sold and total income.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Quiz scoring function
lessons.learning_outcomes: Write a function that uses decisions and loops to compare user answers to correct ones, counting correct/incorrect answers. Output: A script that defines a grading function, runs it on a sample answer list, and prints the final quiz score and feedback.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Buggy loop clinic
lessons.learning_outcomes: Diagnose and fix common logical and looping errors (off‑by‑one, misplaced breaks, wrong conditions) in given short code snippets. Output: A script containing corrected versions of several small loops, each printing before/after behavior to show the fix.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Secret message slicer
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use string indexing and slicing (including negative indices and steps) to extract hidden words from “coded” messages. Output: A script that takes several sample coded strings and prints the decoded words using carefully chosen slices.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Password analyzer
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine functions, decisions, loops, counters, and string indexing/slicing to analyze password strength based on character types and length. Output: A script that reads or uses sample passwords, counts character categories, and prints a strength rating with a short explanation.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Working with Strings and Lists
chapters.learning_goals: Build confidence using Python strings and lists to clean text, organize data, and analyze simple datasets. Students will learn key string methods, list creation and mutation, indexing and slicing, and list iteration, then apply them in small, practical scripts.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: String skills upgrade ii: common methods
lessons.learning_outcomes: Apply strip, lower, replace, and find; Split text and rejoin with delimiters; Handle whitespace and empty fields

lessons.title: Lists i: creating lists
lessons.learning_outcomes: Create lists with literals and from range(); print length with len().; Explain that lists are mutable and show a visible effect of mutation.; Understand when a list is a better choice than separate variables.

lessons.title: Lists ii: indexing and slicing
lessons.learning_outcomes: Access list elements by index and understand how indexing works.; Modify list elements and create sublists using slicing.; Handle out-of-range errors (IndexError) in list access.

lessons.title: Lists iii: mastering list iteration
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use a for loop with range() and len() to iterate over indices and access list elements by their position.; Use a for loop to iterate directly over the values in a list and perform actions on each element.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Comment cleaner
lessons.learning_outcomes: Apply strip, lower, replace, and find to clean and normalize user comments, and handle empty or whitespace‑only input safely. Output: A script that processes a list of raw comments and prints cleaned, normalized versions plus notes about empty entries.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Shopping list builder
lessons.learning_outcomes: Create lists from literals and range(), show mutability by updating items, and explain why a list is better than separate variables. Output: A script that builds a shopping list, modifies quantities and items, and prints the list before and after changes.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Playlist slicer
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use list indexing and slicing to access, modify, and subselect songs while handling potential IndexError cases gracefully. Output: A script that prints specific songs by index, creates sub‑playlists with slices, updates some entries, and catches out‑of‑range access with a friendly message.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Exam scores analyzer
lessons.learning_outcomes: Iterate over lists both by index (range + len) and by value to compute statistics like minimum, maximum, and average. Output: A script that processes a list of exam scores and prints each score, its index, and overall min/max/average results.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Word frequency counter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine string methods (split, lower, replace) with list iteration to build a simple word frequency table from a short text. Output: A script that takes a sample paragraph, cleans it, splits it into words, and prints each unique word with its count.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions
